remain.translation[0].definitions[0].def: to continue to be in the same state or condition
remain.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: Please remain seated until all the lights are on.
Many scientists remain unconvinced by the current evidence.
Despite the job losses, Parker remained as manager.
remain.translation[0].definitions[0].not: Remain is a linking verb in this meaning This type of verb links the subject of the sentence with an adjective or noun
He remains undecided about what to do
remain.translation[0].definitions[1].def: to stay in the same place without moving away
remain.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: She was too ill to remain at home.
The refugees were allowed to remain in the UK.
remain.translation[0].definitions[2].def: to continue to exist or be left after others have gone, been used, or been destroyed
remain.translation[0].definitions[2].exa: Little of the original building remains.
The score is tied, with fifteen minutes remaining.
What remains of his original art collection is now in the city museum.
remain.translation[0].definitions[2].not: In everyday English, people usually say that something is left rather than remains.
Not much of the old town is left.
remain.translation[0].definitions[3].def: to be left after other things have been dealt with
remain.translation[0].definitions[3].exa: The fact remains that racism is still a considerable problem.
Several points remain to be settled.
There remained a few jobs still to be finished.
